summary:
The Russian Civil War (1917â€“1922) followed the fall of the Tsar and the October Revolution. It was a fight between the Bolsheviks (Red Army) led by Vladimir Lenin, and the White Army, made up of various groups opposing Bolshevik rule. Foreign countries also intervened.

The Bolsheviks initially controlled most of the former Russian Empire but faced challenges. The White Army launched offensives, but by 1920, they were defeated. The war ended with the Bolsheviks forming the Soviet Union, but some areas gained independence. There were many casualties, mostly civilians.
title: Russian Civil War
